intro: Microchilus zonatus, commonly known as the zoned microchilus, is a species of flowering plant in the family Campanulaceae. It is native to the mountainous regions of South America, particularly in countries like Peru and Bolivia. The plant is characterized by its small, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pale blue. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in high-altitude grasslands. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
